title: Can you really see who viewed your profile on Facebook? - Quora

response.answer_text: There is NO way you could tell who visited your profile. Most of the people would tell you to follow these steps 1)Go to your browser 2)Open View Page Source . 3)Hold CTRL+F on your keyboard, a text box appears at the right corner, in that box, type- “InitialChatFriendsList”. 4)Go to Facebook and type http://www.facebook.com/Id And now the people who show are the one who visited you're profile.  PEOPLE CONFUSE {InitialChatFriendsList } WITH THE PEOPLE WHO VISITED YOUR PROFILE. But what it actually means is that these are people Who likes, comments share [Your pages ,posts, pictures ,views your timeline, chats with you ] These all along with other factors determine the collective score for Facebook's algorithm(which displays these InitialChatFriendsList ) and then the rest is done by JavaScript which puts them in the order which is visible to the client side. Moreover visiting someones profile is server side interaction which cannot be viewed on client side(Page Source) until the Facebook’s team is ready to show you them. And that is not what they wanted from beginning Isn't it? Remember Orkut!(The famous social network site before Facebook) Where you could see the people who visited your profile.  These along with many other factors helped Facebook make edge over other social network sites.  FACEBOOK IS NOT All ABOUT YOU BUT RATHER MORE ABOUT THEM.

Such this kind of question with the meaning of can you see who views your Facebook or things like that is more common among social media topics. Totally, people are curious about their social media accounts and also keen to find more details about their Facebook stalkers to figure out what is happening around their social media platforms.[1] But the bad news is that knowing a lot brings more anxiety and state, and it is also true if you know how to see who views your Facebook profile and, as a result, get you nowhere. Now here I am going to reveal the facts weather really can you see who looks at your Facebook or not? Why all of us want to get every small information from our different social media accounts? Sometimes it seems helpful for some specific activities such as like, follow, stories. In fact it is our right, but something like checking who views our Facebook profile seems interrupting and strange. Is it really help us to gain self confidence or ruin our peace?  Facebook announced that no one could track who viewed your Facebook profile. But what you think? Is it right or… Well, According to Facebook policies, no one can access such privacy data about Facebook users. Also added: ” if If you come across an app that claims to offer this ability, please report the app.” Is there a real way to see who views your profile on Facebook? I mentioned the word “app” some third parties app claim that they can fetch the data about who exactly viewed your Facebook profile, but it is not the real way to see. These apps are known as unreliable apps. However, you are able to see the number of users who viewed your Facebook Page from insight option. Insight is right at the top of the page, and Page view shows all the activities of your Facebook account, such as city and country, gender and age, as well as section. Ulanoff and Filho warn that there are some third parties apps shouldn’t be downloaded because not only thread your security and privacy but also provides you with wrong data about who views your Facebook profile. The possibility of abusing your personal information like password goes up with trusting to these apps; in that case, they can sell this information to other third parties apps. Why does Facebook not like letting see who views your profile? Facebook is worrying about its users’ mentality situations “We all look up friends, former friends, exes, and coworkers on Facebook, and we don’t want users to know when we look up their pages.” If this was possible, there is a chance people would spend less time on the site and thus hurt Facebook’s revenue, Dr. Selepak says. Based on this statement, we can conclude that more details about each social media can separate the people on social networks, and it won’t be necessary to make it known for all types of users. We come to the conclusion that Facebook can track all your moves on its app from finding Facebook profile your location till reads your text messages and so it is a piece of cake for Facebook to recognize who views your Facebook profile. For the option I said you could deny permissions, but for who viewed my Facebook you can do nothing. Footnotes[1] https://il.ink/blog/social-media/can-you-see-who-viewed-your-profile-on-facebook/

That is simply not possible. It is true that Facebook collects data from its user but it never shared it with the User. In case of any legal disputes or hacking or something like that they can provide data if required by the authorities. But here I have found several methods claiming to show users who visit your profile and its totally bullshit. The common method I have seen is that they told you to check page source and search for ‘InitialChatFriendsList’. Honestly it will show the friends who you contacted recently and are online and based on the Facebook chat relativity algorithms. They have no connection with the fact that they visited your profile. Some websites and blogs are misleading the users into thinking that they can find the people who visited their profiles. And there is another scam that tells you to put some java script code in your console. This will simply harm your Facebook account. Some are scripts that automatically like some pages, add you and your friends to group, or allow illegal access to your account. So I will highly recommend all the users to please not fall into these type of misleading information. Let me know whether you agree with me or not. If not provide the reasons with proof.

Since its launch in 2007, Facebook has been the leading social network in the world. However, people who knew other social platforms like Hi5 got used to knowing who visited our profile. But in this social network we have not been able to know who stalkea us, at least until now. Several programming sites present the following methodology that ensures to provide you with the information and necessary steps to find out who has visited your wall. Step 1. Enter your 'Time line', that is, your Facebook news page and then you will right click. A menu with several options will be displayed. Step 2. Click on Inspect, the last option on the menu. You can also enter by pressing Ctrl + Shift + I while on your Facebook page. A window with a series of codes will appear; press Ctrl + F. Step 3. Later the cursor will be positioned in a search engine where you must write down the word "friendslist", in lowercase letters without leaving spaces and without a period at the end. Step 4. Next you will see a series of codes in blue and red. Choose those that are in quotes (""), write it down on a piece of paper or a notepad, since you will not be able to copy and paste. Step 5. Open a new window in your search engine and type: Log In or Sign Up followed by the code you have chosen. Now you just have to press Enter and know the profile of the person who supposedly visited your wall.

No. There is absolutely no way possible to technically know or find information about who viewed your pictures or profile on Facebook. Facebook just doesn’t allow it. MySpace was the only similar social media platform that I can remember that allowed that feature. As for Facebook, the only thing you can do is make what’s called an “educated guess” of who you may think has been stalking/looking at your profile. You can do this by evaluating who comes up in the “people you may know” list. If they are people you actually know but aren’t mutual friends with on Facebook, chances are they searched for you at some point. If they are people you have never seen before chances are they typed your name by accident to search for someone they know who may have the same name or a similar name as you. Again, this would go about making an educated guess and is in no way an accurate for sure way of 100% knowing who looked at your profile. I worked at Facebook for 3 1/2 years as a front end web developer.

When anyone see your profile, the data is asked from the fb server, so that server knows who is asking your data, but that has to be saved in a record somewhere and fb team doesn't do that. Why? There can be many reasons, out of these two might be the best estimations: It will require a lot of data to be maintained and stored.Will you stalk anyone, if you know that the other guy will know it? Obviously not, right? Else this will decrease the surfing time on fb and will directly affect the business and the profit of fb. Also to note that, fb is used for many hrs in a day, mainly by lonely guys, who are actually stalkers!!!So the point is fb doesn't have the code to save that data from the server. Hence the link is detached there itself. Therefore no option via which that data can reach you. This feature works only in few items like, who had seen your story or who is viewing you live, where fb has a code to save that data from the server. Another ways to know who viewed your profile are: Hack the website and add that code. OrHack the fb app of all the users and add the respective code.Do not trust those guys who instructs to, “Right click and check via page source”, they do not know even the meaning of page source, just copying and pasting here some cheap tricks, written by intelligent bloggers on their webpages to get views and earn money.

Within Facebook itself, nope.  The cheat about the List is for the instant chat that shows up on the right.  It is who interacts with you the most, so you will see them there.  And its from your Friends list.  So if you posted anything recently and they clicked on it, they will show up there.  But to actually answer this.  Hmmm, you would need a photo that had extra data in it that contacted a site once opened or displayed.  But Facebook also checks photos and removes all other metadata except for a few things.  Like the GPS if taken with a cellphone and location data was left on.  Camera type, resolution and lot of other things.  But if you try to add extra code to make it traceable, Facebook will auto remove it. So no, there is no way to know who actually visits your profile.  It has to be an interaction, like clicking on your posted things, liking a post and so forth.  But just viewing their page or a photo from your timeline, even if they are a friend or not.  You will never know.  Besides the initial friends chat list will only show who you are a friend with.  Not others who have like your post, photos and such there of.

Yes, here are the stpes:1. you can display your facebook profile you on a big screen and put cameras all across the places. 2. Now, you invite people to that place and keep a watch on who all have viewed your profile. 3. If you can’t precisely count the number of people viewing your profile, then you can also check those camera footage you have placed.4. This will help you know, who and how many people have viewed your profile. On a serious note: FB is an ever evolving social network platform with a more than 1 billion active users. The algorithm they have used, just collects such logs of profile views for each users however at this point of time Facebook Inc. is not willing to let such features revealed to the general users. They use it for internal analysis in better placement of feeds, ads and other such contents. maybe in future they consider giving users access to such features but that may just kill the beauty of connecting the world without being bothered of who’s viewing me.moreover why you should be bothered who has viewed your profile. Rather you should focus on more meaningful things in life.Note: Please don’t get offended. :)

You don't, that was one of features that made it different from the start, if you are gonna put your details on a public website then it's gonna be looked at, moving deal you just don't sign up if it's a concern…. There are numerous Firefox and Chrome extensions that supposedly add that tweak in your browser allowing you see who viewed you and adds other features to your experience on Facebook, whether they really work or not is another matter, I've never used any of them, I don't install any extensions on my browsers, there's no need for anything except an ad blocker, but if you wanna waste some system resources and possibly add vulnerable extensions to your browser go right ahead…. Or just live with the mystery of never knowing, if in doubt make it friends only, turn your privacy way up so nothing is available except the basics, or deactivate your account

There is no way a person can know that you have visited his/her profile page in Facebook.it’s not like Linkedin where you’ll be getting noitifications for viewer. yeah, It holds database about users and displays userid’s in sourcecode according to recent chats or who’s profile you have visted recently vice versa or who’s posts you have liked recently etc.,I think there is an algorithm to sortout these. As many people are saying you can actually see who’s viewing your profile with the below steps : Go to your timeline →“RIGHTclick” on it→Select “View page source (Ctrl+U)” →A new window with source code will open then press “Ctrl+F”→a text box appears then type InitialChatFriendsList now you will see a list of numbers which are ID’s of your profile viewersCtrl+c and Ctrl+v one among ID beside your fb url. i..e, http://www.facebook.com/xxxxxxxxxx (inplace of xxxxxxxxxxxx)now you’ll see the profile of that ID. I have tested this technique, This includes people only from my friend list, not general. I mean it doesn't show the person if he /she is not your friend and those are my recent chats. So, I guess there is no such way to findout !!

NO, it’s not possible. Not in any way unless someone interacted with something you posted or updated. Even then it doesn’t mean they viewed your profile but that they saw the post, most probably in their News Feed. Please don’t trust any apps that say they can show you who’s viewed your profile. This are phishing apps and will try to steal your login details by telling you to login to Facebook or some other service on their site which will end up being really bad for you. If you’ve done this before and have the same password for other social media platforms, emails or other sensitive accounts; stop everything you’re doing and go change those passwords now before you find yourself in a lot of trouble.

STEPS: 0) Copy my javascript code available here - kamalpluto/Who-Visited-Your-Facebook-Page. 1) Open facebook website in your computer. 2) Sign into your account. 3) Press F12 on your keyboard. 4) Move to "Console" Tab. 5) Paste the code in console and press enter - You will find the names of people who visited your Facebook Page.

Actually, if you are a good hacker, then you can! You just log into website of Facebook(not Facebook app) with your profile. Right click on the website and then click on ‘page source’. A new tab with codes written on it will open. Scroll down until you see a set of various numbers separated by commas. These numbers are the Ids of the people who viewed your profile on Facebook. If you are a hacker, then find out who owns these IDs as Facebook doesn't give you the feature to know these IDs as they are CONFIDENTIAL. Hope that helps.. :)

And granting permission to random apps to have access to your chats is also not a great idea.

Yes it is possible. You can see who saw your profile. The feature is buried deep in your privacy settings and is only available on the iOS app for now. To access the list of who has viewed your profile, open the main drop-down menu (the 3 lines) and scroll all the way down to “Privacy Shortcuts.” There, just below the new “Privacy Checkup” feature, you will find the new “Who viewed my profile?” option. Facebook does not provide the functionality to track who is viewing your profile. Third party applications that claim to provide this functionality are also can't provide this. You can report applications that provide untrustworthy experiences by clicking the "Report Application" at the bottom of the application’s About page, or by clicking "Report" at the bottom of any canvas page within the application.
